primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Jesus defeats the Devil in the wilderness through the Word of God, serving as the substitute who passes the test man fails, thereby breaking the power of temptation and accusation.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ... was passing the test not as your example but as your substitute

object.identificatie: Defeat of evil/Salvation of the hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: He came not to be served but to serve and to give his life.
Jesus Christ died for you so even when you screw up God still loves you

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: led by the Spirit into the wilderness
he knew he was about to have to drink the big cup of divine wrath
there is no condemnation for those who are in Jesus Christ
how to defeat it using the Scripture
the Scripture went down in there and showed those lies to be what they were
supernatural darkness and personal, supernatural evil of the demonic
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The preacher explicitly rejects psychological/sociological reductions of evil, insisting on a supernatural, personal opponent that 'magnifies' human sin.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's use of Scripture to resist daily temptation and accusation.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/discipline) is explicitly grounded in the primary program (soteriology). The hearer can only use Scripture effectively if they first see Jesus as Savior, not just Example.

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus Christ was passing the test...
voorbeelden_mens_subject: you’ll be aligning yourself with the forces of evil
you decide to get rid of God

voorbeelden: I urge you to change your worldview.
Satan is not asking Jesus to break one of the Ten Commandments.
we’re going to learn the depth and complexity of evil
how this Scripture actually functions in our lives
Jesus Christ... was passing the test not as your example but as your substitute

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of Christ's finished work which provides the competence the hearer lacks.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the reality of S2 (Evil/Devil) to the failure of ~S1 (Moralism) to the victory of S1 (Christ as Substitute).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ takes the 'cup of divine wrath' (S2), satisfying the law so that the hearer moves from accusation to grace.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; the sermon spends significant time establishing the 'depth and complexity' of evil to make grace necessary.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly warns against 'exemplarism' and centers on Christ as the substitute who accomplishes what the hearer cannot.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential for 'Be like Jesus' in Scripture use
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: how Jesus uses the Scripture and how we can, too

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: As long as Jesus is only your example, Satan has you right where he wants you.
Jesus Christ, who is passing the test not as your example but as your substitute

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The preacher explicitly deconstructs exemplarism as a 'trap of the Devil'.
bijbelse_figures_als_model: Jesus (rejected as primary model, affirmed as substitute)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Jesus as the Second Adam who succeeds where we fail.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'one-two punch' of temptation and accusation.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'depth of evil' to the 'work of Christ' is logically and narratively tight.
spanning_punten: The tension between Jesus as 'Example' (how he used Scripture) and 'Substitute' (what he did for us).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: passing the test not as your example but as your substitute

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit leads Jesus; the Word (Spirit-breathed) empowers the believer.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; evil is described as a 'supernatural darkness' that humans cannot manage.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Christ as the Subject of the primary narrative of salvation.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on Savoir (Knowing the strategies of evil).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current focus on Pouvoir (Christ's power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the application of 'using Scripture' doesn't devolve into a new 'Devoir' (Law).

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The preacher correctly identifies that a weak opponent leads to a weak Savior.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology → Ethics (Scripture use as a response to grace).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in avoiding moralism while preaching a text that is frequently used for moralistic 'tips for living'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the FDR illustration; semiotics reveals that FDR is an actant for 'Human Incompetence'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek word for 'test'; semiotics explains why that 'test' requires a Subject-switch from Man to Christ.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals the 'one-two punch' of the Devil as a functional shift between the actants of Helper (false) and Opponent.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'Christus Victor' framework nested within a 'Penal Substitution' logic.
